body:
Comment 12: 
I don't think it's as inconsistent as it first seems.
1+2 is an ideal integer but var x=1; x+2 is an int.

The problem, though, is there is no place to find the type
in x<y.  We have that problem in one other place - shift -
and we added explicit language to let the context
determine the type.  But this has been an incredibly
rich source of bugs.  My inclination would be to drop
the idea of an ideal bool and say that any comparison
- even comparison of constants - has plain type bool.
